.
SMC for Bilateral Blindness With Bilateral Hearing Loss Considered 40-Percent Disabling
A Veteran is entitled to SMC under
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
and
38 CFR 3.350(e)(1)(iv)
if the SC disabilities include
blindness with LPO or less in both eyes, and
bilateral hearing loss, considered at least 40-percent disabling, or
SC hearing loss in at least one ear.
Note
:Â  If bilateral blindness is present, but visual acuity in either eye is better than LPO, the Veteran is entitled to an additional full step only in the level of SMC, not to exceed that provided by
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
, per
38 CFR 3.350(f)(2)(vi)
.
